I actually lost a job, that was somewhat like meals on wheels. Apparently giving away fresh food, that would’ve been thrown out was wrong. I was told I should’ve let the homeless man just dig in the trash, I’ll trade the look on his face for that bag of food for anything- any day. I love people, and I hope to have a kitchen big enough to feed whomever may be hungry some day.

Walmart was discovered to be throwing out perfectly good, edible food; some of it was frozen with "good to" dates months in the future.  When asked why they didn't give it to Food Banks for the hungry, they said, "we are in the business of making money, not feeding the hungry."  I have never gone through a Walmart door again.

Worked at the army base here in missouri working in the mess halls. We threw out tons and tons of food every night and i asked why we just didnt donate it and was told simply, "we use to donate it but we ended up getting sued because someone got sick and said it was the food so we stopped donating..." it sucks either way but companies have been sued for the stupidest of things
